Major_Arcs.title: Arrival, Conflict, and Shifting Relationships in Ghost Town
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc covers the initial mystery of the woman's arrival in Ghost Town, the introduction of characters like Cal and Nan, and the unfolding conflicts related to the airport plans, romantic tensions, and the eventual shift to a Western setting with cattle business and gun violence.

sub_scenes.title: Initial Mystery and Airport Conflict
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces the woman's arrival in Ghost Town and her attempts to explain her situation, followed by the discovery of airport plans and her confrontation with the men involved.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival and Explanations in Ghost Town
Discovery of Airport Plans and Confrontation in Ghost Town

sub_scenes.title: Romantic Tensions and Desert Revelation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on the evolving relationship between the woman and Cal, including romantic misunderstandings, internal reflections, and Cal's mysterious 'real offer' in the blasted desert, leading to the work site.

narrative_arcs.title: The Real Offer in the Blasted Desert
Arrival at the Work Site and Confrontation with Workers

sub_scenes.title: Horse Business and Nan's Emotional Turmoil
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shifts the focus to Nan and her family, introducing the horse transportation plan, the airport's relevance to cattle business, and Nan's emotional distress due to her father's reprimands and perceived betrayal by Cal.

narrative_arcs.title: Helping Construction Workers and Crazy Notions
Solace in Tears and Maid's Comfort

sub_scenes.title: Relationship Advice and Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene continues Nan's emotional arc, featuring advice from her mother and maid regarding love and patience, leading to Nan's confrontation with Cal and subsequent chase.

narrative_arcs.title: Mother's Advice on Love and Patience
Maid's Practical Advice and Cal's Love
Desperate Chase and Plea for Attention

sub_scenes.title: Business Urgency and Emotional Confessions
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene intertwines business urgency with personal drama as the focus shifts between the airport deadline for horses and Nan and Cal's emotional confessions and reflections on their relationship.

narrative_arcs.title: Yore Dad's Deal and No Backing Down

sub_scenes.title: Love, Weather Crisis, and Community Aid
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene transitions from personal confessions to a community-wide crisis with a severe snowstorm, highlighting romantic affection amidst growing danger and culminating in the arrival of 'Operation Hay Lift'.

narrative_arcs.title: Sound of Hope: Arrival of the Plane

sub_scenes.title: Cowtown Showdown and Conflicting Perspectives on Chane Benson
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shifts to a 'Cowtown' setting, introducing Chane Benson and presenting various perspectives on his character, from public intrigue to critical analysis and a more mature outlook.

narrative_arcs.title: Jeff's Critical Opinion of Chane Benson
Sally and Older Man's More Mature Perspective on Chane Benson

sub_scenes.title: Jeff, Sally, and Escalating Gun Violence
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on Jeff and Sally's interaction, highlighting Jeff's hero worship of his brother Clyde, Sally's concerns about gun violence, and a heated argument culminating in an implied threat of violence.

narrative_arcs.title: Reflecting on Past Hero Worship and Questioning Gun Handling

sub_scenes.title: Reassurance, Storytelling, and Rising Tension
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene features Sally and Clyde's attempt to address Jeff's issues, the introduction of Mr. Benson and his unsettling storytelling, setting a stage for rising tension and potential conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Reassurance and Commitment to Change Jeff
Introduction of Mr. Benson and Storytelling

sub_scenes.title: Article Accusation and Benson's Threat
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene escalates the conflict as Sally confronts Clyde about an article, warns him about Benson, and Benson himself intervenes, declaring his intent to fight 'killers' in town, creating a complex web of alliances and threats.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation and Denial about the Article
Benson's Declaration to Stay and Fight Killers

sub_scenes.title: Escalating Conflict and Dinner Invitation Strategy
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts open threats against Surrett, Clyde's resolve to fight back with articles, and a shift in Jeff's companion's opinion leading to a dinner invitation for Benson in an attempt at conciliation.

narrative_arcs.title: Clyde's Defiant Articles and Public Reaction

sub_scenes.title: Dinner's End, Confrontation, and Violence
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene covers the awkward end of the dinner, Benson's unwanted advances towards Jeff's sister, Jeff's angry reaction, and Benson's violent assault on Jeff, escalating the conflict to physical violence.

narrative_arcs.title: End of Dinner and Moonlight Charm

sub_scenes.title: Chase, Standoff, and Benson's Retreat
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Jeff's chase after Benson, the tense standoff in town to protect Clyde, and Benson's eventual retreat, resolving the immediate physical threat but leaving emotional and professional aftermath.

narrative_arcs.title: Resolution of the Standoff and Benson's Departure
Reflecting on Tension and Expressing Remorse
Headline Change, Relief, and Newspaper Work

sub_scenes.title: Range War Introduction and Bodyguard Hiring
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shifts to a new conflict – a range war – introducing Betsy and Steve Daley, her newly hired bodyguard, amidst initial tension and foreshadowing of trouble.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction of Steve Daley as Bodyguard

sub_scenes.title: Bodyguard Role Clarification and Range War Details
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene further clarifies Steve's role as bodyguard, introduces the specifics of the range war and the antagonist 'Double-K', and sets up Betsy's trip to town with Steve.

narrative_arcs.title: Discussion of Range War and Underlying Troubles

sub_scenes.title: Town Visit, Observation, and Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene follows Betsy and Steve to town, where Steve observes Daley, and they encounter Fred Bridges, leading to a violent altercation and observers' reactions to Steve's skills.

narrative_arcs.title: Departure from the Store and Daley's Observation
Confrontation with Fred Bridges and Hired Hand
Observations on Steve's Skills and Impending Danger

sub_scenes.title: Betsy's Conditions and Maverick's Gratitude
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Betsy's decision regarding Steve's employment with a condition, Maverick's misinterpretation of Betsy's actions, Hank's clarification, and Maverick expressing gratitude to Betsy.

narrative_arcs.title: Maverick's Observation and Question to Betsy
Hank Defends Steve and Maverick's Suggestion

sub_scenes.title: Love Confession and Choice Between Love and Duty
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene is centered around Betsy and Steve's burgeoning romance, with Betsy setting conditions for Steve's job, confessing her love, and Steve ultimately choosing love over his gunfighting identity.

narrative_arcs.title: Steve's Dilemma and Betsy's Confession of Love
Steve's Ultimate Proof of Love and Betsy's Acceptance

sub_scenes.title: Range War Escalation and Betsy's Defiance
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene marks the escalation of the range war, with Old Man Bridges confronting Betsy and Hank, accusations of trespassing, and Betsy's defiant stance against threats, culminating in an armed standoff.

narrative_arcs.title: Bridges Confronts Hank and Accuses Trespassing
Betsy and Steve Prepare for Confrontation
Betsy Justifies Gun Violence as Necessary
Betsy Recounts the Ambush and Loss of Horses
Aftermath of the Ambush and Hank's Escape

sub_scenes.title: Betsy's Resolve for Violence and Steve's Ultimatum
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on Betsy's decision to resort to violence, Steve's opposition and ultimatum, leading to their potential separation and Betsy's solitary reflection and decision.

narrative_arcs.title: Ride to Devil's Pass and Gunfire Encounter

sub_scenes.title: Devil's Pass Confrontation and Betsy's Injury
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene describes the arrival at Devil's Pass, Steve's warning, the ensuing gunfight, and Betsy getting injured, leading to immediate aftermath and emotional reconciliation.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at Devil's Pass and Warning

sub_scenes.title: New Romantic Conflict and Ranch Threat
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces a new romantic conflict with a woman refusing to leave with a man, and simultaneously sets up a ranch threat involving Bear Fenin and cattle concerns.

narrative_arcs.title: Concern over Curley and Bear Fenin's Threat

sub_scenes.title: Fence Confrontation and Rancher's Expulsion
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the rancher's discovery of a fence blocking water access, a confrontation with Fred Gordon, escalating tension, and the rancher expelling Fred Gordon and his men.

sub_scenes.title: Past Apologies, Lingering Resentment, and Dinner Invitation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene reflects on past apologies and resentment, introduces Carrie and Dave's relationship, Carrie's dislike for Fred, and ends with an unexpected dinner invitation, setting up potential reconciliation.

narrative_arcs.title: Reflecting on Past Apologies and Lingering Resentment
Carrie's Reluctance to Discuss Fred and Preference for Dave

sub_scenes.title: Sarcastic Confrontation and Tentative Truce
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene features a sarcastic confrontation between Fred Gordon and Carrie, marked by confused identities and ironic dialogue, leading to a tentative truce and a movie invitation.

narrative_arcs.title: Initial Confrontation and Demand to Leave Dave Alone
Reflection on Love and a Marriage Proposal

sub_scenes.title: Deception Realization and Business Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene reveals Carrie's realization of Fred's deceptive contract motive behind his proposal, her angry confrontation, and a shift to a business meeting where Dave unexpectedly arrives.

narrative_arcs.title: Realization of Deception and Contract Motive
Night of Reflection and Business Meeting

sub_scenes.title: Carlton's Office Confrontation and Surrender
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene features Carrie's assertive confrontation of Mr. Carlton in his office, her declaration of independence, and a surprising moment of apparent surrender to Fred in front of her father and Dave.

sub_scenes.title: Farewell, Love Confession, and Flashback Advice
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Carrie's angry farewell to Fred, a chance encounter with Dave in town, Carrie's surprising confession of love for Fred to Dave, and a flashback to her father's advice, revealing her internal conflict.

sub_scenes.title: Illness, Urgent Message, and Beef Contract Revelation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Carrie's illness, Mr. Carlton's urgent arrival with a message, and the revelation about Fred's honorable actions regarding the beef contract, dispelling misunderstandings.

narrative_arcs.title: Carrie's Shame, Regret, and Joyful Ride

sub_scenes.title: Dirk's Injury and Chris's Concern
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces a new storyline with Dirk's sudden arrival injured at Chris's bedroom, a flashback to their earlier meeting, and a doctor's diagnosis of a bullet wound, raising immediate concern for Dirk's well-being.

narrative_arcs.title: Past Encounter - Dirk and Chris Meet

sub_scenes.title: Investigation, Sheriff's Arrival, and Ranch Search
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details the discovery of Dirk's gun, concern for his safety, the arrival of Marshal Cready investigating Dirk, and the Marshal's insistence on searching Chris's ranch, leading to confrontation.

narrative_arcs.title: Concern for Dirk and Investigation Plan
Sheriff Arrives and Identifies Chris & Dirk's Trail

sub_scenes.title: Arrest, Plea for Delay, and Conditional Stay
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on Marshal Cready's interrogation and revelation of Dirk's crime, Chris's plea for a delay due to Dirk's injuries, and the Marshal's conditional decision to stay and guard Dirk.

narrative_arcs.title: Plea for Delay and Conditional Stay

sub_scenes.title: Love Confession, Escape Plan, and Arrest
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene features Chris's confession of love to Marshal Cready, a discussion of escape plans for Dirk, and the Marshal's decisive arrest of Dirk, highlighting conflicting loyalties and duty.

sub_scenes.title: Pursuit, Escape, and Chris's Return
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details the discovery of pursuit, a flashback to evasion attempts, a violent confrontation resulting in Chris being shot, and the immediate aftermath of escape towards Mexico and Chris's decision to return to Rance.

narrative_arcs.title: Fleeing the Scene and Bandaging Wounds
Escape to Mexico and Criminal Escape
Return to Rance and Confession of Love

sub_scenes.title: Rance's Injury and Uncertain Reunion in Mexico
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene portrays Rance's injury, Chris's concern, their conversation about Dirk's escape to Mexico, and Chris's ambiguous arrival in Mexico, hinting at a possible reunion despite previous indications.

narrative_arcs.title: Concern for Rance and Separate Paths
Arrival in Mexico and Uncertain Reunion

sub_scenes.title: Rance's Recovery and Love Confession
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on Rance's recovery from unconsciousness, Chris attending to him, her confession of love, and the older Marshal leaving them to have a private conversation.

narrative_arcs.title: Inquiry About Business and Father's Opinion

sub_scenes.title: Wedding Plans, Lingering Fears, and Dirk's Return
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene covers wedding plans, Chris's lingering fears about Dirk, the peaceful passage of time leading to the wedding day, and Dirk's dramatic and unexpected return during the ceremony.

narrative_arcs.title: Vows and Fears Before the Wedding

sub_scenes.title: Dirk's Capture, Explanation, and Resolution
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene resolves the Dirk subplot with his capture being explained as planned, Dirk's humorous acceptance, and backstory revealing Rance's past support for Dirk, leading to a peaceful resolution at the wedding.

narrative_arcs.title: Backstory of the Man and Rance's Support
